result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander CD Otis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "F" Felony], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "F" Felony], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "F" Felony], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property >$10,000 [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "G" Felony], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Concurrent.
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.
-Victims to be made whole firest before payment to the Insurance  Company.
-50% of the Defendant's prison wages to be garnished for restitution.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

superMiscConds.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Order signed by Judge Eric J. Lundell May 31, 2016.

$50,692.98  restitution to be collected through prison wages and then DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF292.
$7000.00 restitution to be collected through prison wages and then DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF292.
$30000.00 restitution to be collected through prison wages and then DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF292.
$12307.02 restitution to be collected through prison wages and then DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF292.

$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF292.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF292.
Not to use or possess firearms.

-NO CONTACT whatsoever with Jerri Clemas, Helen Clemas or Dillan Clemas.
-Defendant also to follow through with any recommended treatment by the COMPAS Evaluation or DOC.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Court permits random UA testing at the discretion of the Agent.
-Defendant to be fully employed within 30 days of being released.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment and/or therapy.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY: Nicholas Von Davis, DF: Alexander CD Otis appeared.  Court called at 1:35 p.m.  Set for SEH.  DE has filed an amended Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form.  DE had plead Guilty to Ct. 1 at the 03/24/15 Plea Hearing.   All other counts were held open until the SEH being held today.  DE now will be pleading to additional counts.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights.  Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads additional charges and maximum penalties. DE pleads Guilty to Ct 2, Ct 3 & Ct 4.  Court reviews the Criminal Complaint.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudciated guilty of Ct 2, Ct 3 & Ct 4.  On motion of the State, Crt reads in and dismisses Cts 5-9. Sentencing arguments. Victim reads impact statement.  DE makes statement.  DEs mother makes statement.  Crt orders:

Ct.1 in 14CF292  
DE sentenced to 7 years 6 months  Initial Confinement with 5 Years Extended Supervision
- 4 days credit for time served
- DE is ordered that he have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons, Jerri Clemas, Helen Clemas or Dillan Clemas.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  
- AODA and follow through with any recommended treatment or therapy
- DE also to follow through with any recommended treatment by the COMPAS Evaluation or the Department of Corrections.
-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-  Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-  Not to use or possess firearms.
-  Crt permits random UA testing at the discretion of the Probation Agent.
- Restitution to be paid in the amount of $78,917.84.  Victims to be made whole first before any payment to the insurance company.
- 50% of the DE's prison wage to be garnished for restitution.
- Once released 25% of the DE's wage to be garnished for restitution
- DE to be fully employed within 30 days of being released 
- DE to give a DNA sample
- Court costs total $1072 and $1,000 for the DNA surcharge to be paid through the DOC

Ct. 2, Ct. 3 & Ct. 4 to run concurrent with Ct. 1

- DE remanded to the custody of the St. Croix County Sheriff's Department to be transported to Dodge
- 20 days to appeal
from Atty. Davis requesting a continuance. Per EJL on 11-05-2015 approved to reset. gme

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael E. Nieskes, DF ATTY: Owen R. Williams, DF:  Alexander CD Otis appeared.  Court called at 9:27 a.m.   Attorneys recite the agreement.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Court questions the DE.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  DE pleads Guilty to Ct 1.   Attorney's stipulate to the facts in the Criminal Complaint.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of Ct. 1.  Court orders the remaining counts open until sentencing.  Court orders a PSI and COMPAS Evaluation.  DE to report to probation today 03/24/15.  Bail is continued.  Sentencing will be set once the PSI is reviewed.  Court adjourned at 9:41 a.m. lw

-Defendant to remain on home arrest.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Jerri C. and Helen C. and Dillan C. or their residences. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
